what: Miscellaneous Functions and Themes in Use at Covalence Research
title: Miscellaneous Functions and Themes in Use at Covalence Research
text: covalencer contains various R functions use Covalence Research health economic modeling, literature synthesis, medical communication, just plain old data wrangling. Perhaps notably, provides access Covalence ggplot theme associated color palettes.

title: Miscellaneous Functions and Themes in Use at Covalence Research
text: can install development version covalencer GitHub :

title: Miscellaneous Functions and Themes in Use at Covalence Research
text: Apply theme_covalence() existing ggplot object, like theme.
code: library(ggplot2) library(covalencer)  ggplot(data = diamonds, aes(x = price, y = carat)) +     geom_point(aes(color = color), alpha = 0.5) +     scale_colour_covalence_d(palette = "complete") +     facet_wrap(vars(cut)) +     theme_covalence()

title: Covalence colors — covalence_colors
text: Covalence brand colors, including primary colors ('lightblue', 'darkblue', 'teal', 'grey') accent colors ('red', 'green', 'purple', 'orange').

title: Covalence colors — covalence_colors
Covalence palette — covalence_palette
text: various Covalence palettes: complete palette contains brand colors. main palette contains main, mostly blue-ish, brand colors. accent palette contains additional, prominent colors.

title: Covalence palette — covalence_palette
Covalence palette — covalence_palette
text: ... Arguments passed . palette Palette use. One 'complete', 'main', 'accent'.

title: Covalence palette — covalence_palette
text: named vector brand colors.

title: Covalence palette — covalence_palette
text: function slightly modified 2022 blog post Meghan Hall.

title: Covalence palette — covalence_palette
code: require(scales) #> Loading required package: scales show_col(covalence_palette(palette = "main"))

what: Function factory to generate palette — generate_pal
title: Function factory to generate palette — generate_pal
text: function generates second function, use 'ggplot' scales.

title: Function factory to generate palette — generate_pal
Function factory to generate palette — generate_pal
text: palette Palette use. One 'complete', 'main', 'accent'. n Number colors wanted palette. type Type palette. Either 'discrete' 'continuous'. reverse palette reversed? Either 'TRUE' 'FALSE'.

title: Function factory to generate palette — generate_pal
text: palette-generating function.

title: Function factory to generate palette — generate_pal
text: function slightly modified 2022 blog post Nicola Rennie.

what: Covalence color and fill scale for ggplot2 — scale_colour_covalence_d
title: Covalence color and fill scale for ggplot2 — scale_colour_covalence_d
text: scale_*_covalence_* functions provide discrete (_d) continuous (_c) scales Covalence colors use ggplot2 plots.

title: Covalence color and fill scale for ggplot2 — scale_colour_covalence_d
code: scale_colour_covalence_d(palette = "complete", reverse = FALSE)  scale_color_covalence_d(palette = "complete", reverse = FALSE)  scale_fill_covalence_d(palette = "complete", reverse = FALSE)  scale_colour_covalence_c(palette = "complete", reverse = FALSE)  scale_color_covalence_c(palette = "complete", reverse = FALSE)  scale_fill_covalence_c(palette = "complete", reverse = FALSE)

title: Covalence color and fill scale for ggplot2 — scale_colour_covalence_d
text: palette Palette use. One 'complete', 'main', 'accent'. reverse palette reversed? Either 'TRUE' 'FALSE'.

title: Covalence color and fill scale for ggplot2 — scale_colour_covalence_d
text: Discrete/continuous color/fill scales ggplot2.

title: Covalence color and fill scale for ggplot2 — scale_colour_covalence_d
text: function modified 2022 blog post Meghan Hall.

title: Covalence color and fill scale for ggplot2 — scale_colour_covalence_d
code: library(ggplot2)  ggplot(data = diamonds, aes(x = carat, y = price)) +   geom_point(aes(color = cut), alpha = 0.4) +   scale_color_covalence_d(palette = "complete") +   theme_covalence()   ggplot(data = diamonds, aes(x = carat, y = price)) +   geom_point(aes(color = x), alpha = 0.4) +   scale_colour_covalence_c(palette = "complete") +   theme_covalence()   ggplot(data = diamonds, aes(x = price)) +   geom_histogram(aes(fill = cut)) +   scale_fill_covalence_d(palette = "complete", reverse = TRUE) +   theme_covalence() #> `stat_bin()` using `bins = 30`. Pick better value with `binwidth`.

what: The default Covalence ggplot2 theme — theme_covalence
title: The default Covalence ggplot2 theme — theme_covalence
text: theme provides defaults required generate plots, using ggplot2, aligned Covalence Research house style. theme can modified using theme(). Also consider using various color palettes ensure house style met.

title: The default Covalence ggplot2 theme — theme_covalence
The default Covalence ggplot2 theme — theme_covalence
text: base_size Base font size, points. Default 12. base_family Base font family. Default "sans". strip_bg_color Color fill strip backgrounds. Default #326aa0. strip_text_color Color strip labels. Default #FFFFFF (white).

title: The default Covalence ggplot2 theme — theme_covalence
text: ggplot2 theme object.

title: The default Covalence ggplot2 theme — theme_covalence
code: library(ggplot2)  ggplot(data = msleep, aes(x = brainwt, y = bodywt)) +    geom_point() +    theme_covalence() #> Warning: Removed 27 rows containing missing values (`geom_point()`).   ggplot(data = msleep, aes(x = awake, y = name)) +    geom_col() +    facet_wrap(vars(vore)) +    theme_covalence()
